intro: Boehmeria guatemalensis, commonly known as Guatemalan nettle, is a flowering plant species native to Central America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Boehmeria guatemalensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
